intro: Corybas karoensis, commonly known as the Karoens mountain strelitzia, is a rare and unique orchid species native to the high-altitude regions of New Guinea. It is characterized by its striking, hooded flower that resembles a helmet, which is a distinctive feature among the genus Corybas. The plant typically grows in rocky or mossy habitats, thriving in cool and humid conditions. Its flowers are usually a deep purple or red, with a central lip that serves as a nectar source for specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Corybas karoensis is considered a vulnerable species.
